name: Homewood Suites by Hilton San Diego-Del Mar

reviews.text: Im taking time out from my 3 small children to tell everyone how happy and impressed we were with this hotel. We stayed here 6 nights while visiting the Zoo, Sea World, Legoland, etc. The hotel was very clean, new, and the staff could not have been nicer. The FREE buffet breakfast every morning was perfect, huge selection to eat from, waffle maker, eggs, bacon,biscuits and more. Then in the evening from 5-7 is a FREE dinner- yes free....with wine! This worked out super, bc after being at an amusement park all day we were all tired and hungry. It was great to go back to the hotel after a long day and enjoy a meal as a family and then all get in the hot tub and relax before bed.
reviews.title: Could not have asked for better

reviews.text: Our hotel room had a large room with the king bed in it and full bath, then another separate living room with a desk, kitchen(very convienient for left overs and any groceries), and fold out couch and TV for the kids to sleep on and watch cartoons when they wake up.
reviews.title: Business Trip - Great Restaurant

reviews.text: We would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!!! Perfect!!
reviews.title: An Absolute Treat

reviews.text: This was a really great find – close to everything, but out of the city. You usually don't have a great meal at this type of hotel – but dinner here was really good. Get the steak with blue-cheese – you will not be sorry!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: From check-in to check-out our stay here was perfect. The employees were friendly and accommodating and seemed to really enjoy their job. The breakfast was the best I've had at any hotel and you didn't feel like you had to get there early before they ran out, it was always fully stocked. The amenities were great and any and all questions we had were answered by either the desk clerks or the manager. I really felt they cared about us as guests. Traveling with two young kids is very difficult and it really meant a lot when I was having difficulty getting breakfast for the two kids to the table and the general manager, Ann Marie, came over to help because she has a young one at home and said she knows what it's like. That extra touch made my day and I will definitely be staying at Homewood Suites from now on.
reviews.title: Very nice facilty, awesome staff.

reviews.text: During a 4-day family reunion in the area, the Homewood Suites Del Mar was our home base and very well worth every penny.
reviews.title: Home, not hotel-like atmosphere

reviews.text: PROS: Located just off of Interstate 5, the Homewood Suites is easily accessible from all points on a compass. Despite its close proximity to the highway, there is little to no traffic noise - being situated on a hill certainly helps. Torrey Pines State Park & Beach are within a 5-7 minute drive. For the active-types, you'll certainly get your running in with the surrounding hills and spacious bike lanes which will take you right to Torrey Pines, or should you crave a little more inland trail running action, Los Penasquitos Inland Preserve resides just to the east. There are beach supplies available for rent (beach chairs, umbrella, boogie board) individually or as a package deal ($30) which is convenient for beach-goers that packed light. There are multiple grocery stores (Vons) and restaurants within driving distance or utilize the handy shuttle provided by Homewood Suites. There is plenty of room in a King-size suite to stock up the fridge and freezer.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The room itself was very well kept and housekeeping maintained strong attention to detail by restocking the room with fresh towels each day. Kitchen supplies are abundant all the way down to the mini-cutting board. Our room overlooked the courtyard in which a small pool and hot tub were situated among tropical plants.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Diego / Del Mar Area

reviews.text: We also checked out their evening reception as the schedule was posted on the fridge. Their daily offerings vary from enchiladas, teriyaki chicken, and of course the BBQ Thursday nights. While outside dining options throughout San Diego are delicious, the evening reception is convenient and satisfying as it is accompanied by a full and fresh salad bar. The wine offerings left much to be desired. It would be nice to see some offerings from local vineyards (i.e. Temecula). Breakfast showcased the strength of Homewood Suites with real eggs (not that powdery, dry stuff), sausage, bacon, potatoes, fresh fruit (not day-old), and waffles.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Clean, Rooms a little dated

reviews.text: CONS: It was tough to find one, however, travelers should note that wireless internet access is available only on the first floor rooms. Only hardwired, ethernet connections are available on the other floors. This may be problematic for some - not all. There is a spa at the nearby Hilton Garden Inn which we did not take advantage of, however, while comparing prices to the spa just down the road, the prices at the hotel spa were relatively high for treatments.
reviews.title: Excellent Room and service

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days on our trip to US recently. This place was the first stop. We got confused with the similar sounding name in San Diego and ended up driving to that one ( which has an excellent location and is rightfully better rated than this hotel).
reviews.title: excellent value
Excellent bang for your buck!
reviews.text: First of all you need a car to stay at this hotel due to the location which is a few minutes drive from S Diego.

The service and the food beats all the cons for this place. The dinner we had ( only managed to get for the first day on a thursday) which was BBQ dinner was excellent. It included free wine ( both red and white) and light beer. The meat was excellent quality.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The Bfast was excellent also for the price you pay for this place.
reviews.title: HOME-LIKE COMFORT -- for a hotel

reviews.text: Its close to I5 highway which helps.
reviews.title: Superb service

reviews.text: Hotel has easy access from I-5. My room had some issues - Clock didn't work and person in next room suffered from sleep apnea. I have never heard anything like that. I was awakened by the snoring both nights. I ended up getting a little rest on the living room sofa. Hotel was pretty quiet otherwise. Exercise room was very small. One of the treadmills didn't work.
reviews.title: Great if you want a kitchen, free breakfast, free internet and free parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms don't have sinks inside bathroom. I find that to be a big turn off. Hotel provides complimentary internet and hot breakfast and some afternoon dinner. I only had a yogurt and did not take advantage of the dinner with free beer and wine. Parking was free.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.text: Young lady at front desk just said, "sorry to hear that" to my complaints. She also could not provide any directions.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every respect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel & would highly recommend. The location was perfect for us - 20 minutes to the airport, 15 minutes to Sea World, 25 minutes to Safari Park. Close enough to all the major attractions without having to pay $30 for parking. Staff was superb - very helpful, friendly & accomodating. They have a free breakfast that is actually quite good & a lite meal Monday - Thursday. Both were heavily attended so obviously they were very popular. They also have a small area where you can purchase snacks should you get the munchies. We had a king bed suite which had a kitchenette area with a refrig, 2 burner cooktop, dishwasher & microwave. The sitting room had a desk, sofa you could stretch out on & an easy chair. The only complaint I had here is that the desk chair doesn't go up very high in relation to the desk height. Free internet access was a biggie for me plus they had a business center should you need to print out anything. The suite had 2 flat screen TV's. The bathroom set up was a bit different - the toilet & shower were behind a door but the sink was open to the bedroom - I get why they did that but it can be a bit of a pain if one is asleep & the other is up & about. But that is so minor compared to all we found that was right with this place. You do have to drive to get anyplace, it felt as if the hoeld was in a tech area but we had a car & access to I5 & 805 was a breeze. La Jolla was right around the corner as was Del Mar. Parking was ample easy. They had a small fitness center with a recumbant bike, 2 treadmills, an elliptical and set of weights. Hot tub was clean & enjoyed after a long day at the parks. And I have to reiterate, the staff was awesome. We will absolutely stay here again if our travels take us back to San Diego.
reviews.title: Best San Diego Hotel!

reviews.text: Cannot praise the employees highly enough. Each and every employee with whom I came in contact was helpful, kind, and genuinely friendly. Special thanks to Mitchell and Lauren at the Front Desk, and to Art and the other fellows from Maintenance who shuttled me to and from the hospital each day to visit my mother. What was otherwise a very stressful time, was made more bearable through my daily dealings with the personable and competent staff.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Excellent Value

aka: Homewood Suites San Diego-Del Mar Hotel
description: Located in Torrey Hills, near Torrey Pines Beach, the Homewood Suites by Hilton® San Diego-Del Mar was specially designed to provide you with a secluded, stress-free stay. Our contemporary studio, one-bedroom and two-bedroom suites provide a true residential feel with all the comforts and luxuries of home.
